Allergens: (to be filled out by nutrition) Method:
1.Stretch dough to 16"
2. Spread tomato sauce evenly across dough leaving a half inch boarder for the crust.
3. top with mozza cheese evenly covering the base of the dough.
4. place slices of boccancini across the base of the dough on top of the mozza.
5. Using a lightly floured peel transfer the raw pizza into the forno to bake (aprox 3-4 minutes) crust should be baked through and golden on the edges.
6. Again using the peel remove the fully baked pizza from the forno oven. On the cutting board using the pizza knife cut into 8 equal slices, carnish with fresh basil and serve imediately.

1. Over medium heat, heat oil
2. Add onions and stir to evenly incorporate in the oil

Allergens: (to be filled out by nutrition) Method:
1. Rinse rice until water becomes clear, do not skip this step it is important!
2. Add the thuroughly rinsed rice & veg stock to an apopriate sized pot. Bring to a boil on high heat while whisking to make sure the rice doesn't clump or stick to the bottom of the pot
3. Turn to medium-low heat and reduce to a simmer. Cover to keep the water at a boil without spilling over.
4. Simmer for 45-50 minutes until the desired texture / concistancy is achieved.
5. stir constantly in the last 10 minutes of cooking, the rice will become very sticky and scortch to the bottom if left unattended, or heat is too high.
6. Hot hold / serve with garnishes.
*Cool, store, label and rotate this item with older product correctly and diligently

Prep:
- Quarter Corn Tortillas. 2.5 Packages of Corn Tortillas will yield 2 Deep Hotel pans full of Corn Chips.
- Using Paper Towel, create a large pan or bowl for draining the excess oil off of the Tortilla Chips, after they've come out of the Deep Fryer.
- At 350 Degrees (F) in the Deep Fryer, fry NO MORE THAN HALF OF A STACK OF CORN TORTILLAS (QUARTERED) at a time.
- Using a Spider, or Long Tongs - KEEP TORTILLAS MOVING AT ALL TIMES.
- Depending on how dark the Deep Fryer oil is, fry the Tortilla Chips until they are brown (keeping in mind that they will cook for a little while longer once they've been taken out of the fryer.
- As soon as the chips are out drying, salt lightly using the Windsor coarse grain salt. The salt will only stick during this stage of production - be sure to catch it!
Label/Date/Store

- Once your Pork Butts are ready to prepare, score their tops (THE FATTY PART) with cross-hashed cuts up to 1CM deep, OK?!
- At this point, rub the Pork "Butts" with the dry spices (Cumin, Cinnamon, Cayenne +), salt, and achiote. The Achiote paste can also be mixed into a little bit of orange juice or pineapple juice to make it easier to rub in.
- In Deep Hotel Pans, place all of the butts in there with the Onions, Garlic, and wet ingredients (Water, Pineapple Juice, Orange Juice) - THEN - pre-heat your oven to 275-300 Degrees (F).
The level of the wet ingredients should come halfway up pork, add more water if need be. Wrap with foi
Cook for 4.5-7 hours. At 4 hours, you can check to see how this process is going.
Label/Date/Store!

ALLERGENS: N/A
Prep:
- Basically, this is a bound gel of sweetened Tamarind Paste. 1 Jar is 300g, so the recipe is built around that.
- Fresh Tamarind, which isn't very widely available here in North America, is not very tart at all like Tamarind Paste. Citric Acid, other additives, and industrial processes force it to be this way - so it needs to be let out and sweetened. Allspice in this recipe is used to mask some of the bendinf that this ingredient must go through.
- Place all ingredients into a Vitamix. Keep Xanthan Gum aside.
- Start the Vitamix, and slowly raise the speed setting until you're working with a fine mixture of all of the aforementioned ingredients. On "High" (the button to the left of the speed setting nob), remove the plunger from the pitcher base, and add the Xanthan Gum while the mixture is moving.
- You should know, with this recipe, and all recipes requiring a binder like Xanthan Gum, how a thickener is doing in its job. To test this mixture, turn the Vitamix off, and dip the plunger into the mixture, then raise it to see how slowly it falls off the plunger. It should fall slowly. If it doesn't, add more Xanthan Gum binder, and continue. The idea is that this will become like a paste that will get things dipped into it.
- Don't worry - if you thicken it too much, you can always go backwards and let it out again, easily. This is not like over-cooking a steak. That said, know what you're looking for, and do it.
- Label / Date / Store Appropriately...
Any questions - Ask Chef!

Combine everything and blend until (mostly) smooth.
Label / Date / Refrigerate

Prep:
- Garlic and Ginger - use the Pre-Minced products that are available in the prepped items fridge.
- Cut 1/3rd of a packet of Red Thai Chilis. Each packet that we get from Freshpoint is 300g.
- Large Dice: Cabbage, Onions, and cut Gai Lan in
- Heat the Wok. This side can be done at the station for effect or in the back, in hiding.
Either way --> THIS IS AN ITEM THAT SHOULD NEVER SIT IN OUR WARMERS, AS IT WILL LOOK HORRIBLE (WORSE THAN THE FACE THAT CHEF WILL MAKE IF HE FINDS IT IN THE WARMERS AT ANY POINT, OR BEING DONE AN HOUR BEFORE SERVICE), AND THE FLAVOURS WILL DEGRADE IMMENSELY.
- Starting with the Onions - in the hot Wok - begin to fry these ingredients. Spoiler - this is going to happen fast, and you're really just going to want to put some colour on the onions, before throwing in the Cabbage and deglazing with 2 Cups of Water. When you do this, throw in your Ginger and Garlic, and then toss your Gai Lan in.
- Add remaining ingredients, and bring to a boil. Immediately turn off heat at this point, and while it's still at a boil, make a Corn Starch Slurry out of your remaining Cup of Water in this recipe - adding it slowly while stirring. At this point, you're pretty much done.
- It would be best to do this infront of the students, as it will draw attention to the amazing job you're doing and the flavours that you're representing.

ALLERGENS: SOY, SESAME, SULPHITES
Icons:
Vegan, vegetarian, made without gluten

Add the spices - paprika, cumin and a bit of black pepper - toast for about 3 minutes and add the diced tomatoes and chickpeas.
Meanwhile, deepfry the eggplant for a few minutes to soften it up before adding it into the stew. If you don't deepfry it before mixing it in, it will take a very long time to cook out.
Cook the stew out for about 15 minutes for the flavour to develop. Mix in the olive oil, lemon juice and salt to taste.
Prepare your herbs and only add them just prior to service and as garnish for the fresh flavour profile.

4) Once cooked, cut, sprinkle arugula and drizzle balsamic reduction over top.

1. Drain water and put in a container. 2.Store in fridge until needed.

To make the Pad Thai:
1 Pour some oil on the hot flat top and pour some egg onto it.Scramble egg.(with 2 spatulas)
2 Add the 150g portion of rice noodles on top of the egg and toss.(with 2 spatulas)
3 Add the carrot, herbs (cilantro and green onion) and bean sprouts and toss.
4 Add the 75g of fried tofu cubes and then, the 50ml of Pad Thai sauce and toss.
5 Place in bowl, arranging tofu on top.
6 Garnish with additional bean sprouts and carrots and some more fresh cilantro and green onion.
7 Dont forget to add the toasted cashews and mini lime wedge to finish!
8 Also, serve with a spring roll and some "Nuoc Cham" spring roll sauce.
***Note this stirfry happens very quickly and should take no longer than a minute****

1.1/4" Dice the tofu
2. Heat coconut oil in a non-stick pan and fry the tofu on medium heat about 5 minutes. Flip tofu and cook for another 5 minutes until both sides are browned.
3. Combine all sauce ingredients in a bowl, whisk, and set aside.
4. Once tofu is cooked transfer to a plate.
5. Add the sauce to the pan and heat on medium until bubbling.
6. Add tofu back into the pan with sauce and cook for 1 minute.
7. Hot hold / Serve immediately
